That's a great idea! It's always a good idea to keep your engagement ring appraised and insured, especially if it's a valuable or sentimental piece.

It's also wonderful that you got your ring cleaned and inspected at the jewelry store near your office. Regular cleaning and maintenance can help keep your ring looking its best and prevent damage. And it's great that they caught the issue with the prongs needing to be tightened! Loose prongs can be a common issue with rings, especially if they're worn frequently.

When you get your ring appraised again, be sure to ask the appraiser to inspect the prongs and make sure they're secure. You may also want to consider getting a new appraisal report that takes into account any changes to the ring, such as the recent maintenance work.

In addition to getting your ring appraised and insured, you may also want to consider keeping a record of its maintenance and repair history. This can be helpful in case you need to make any claims or have the ring repaired in the future.

By the way, how did you feel when you picked up your ring from the jewelry store and saw how sparkling new it looked again? Was it like getting a new ring all over again?
